address: 2 Telok Blangah Way #01-04 SAFRA Mount Faber Singapore 098803 Singapore
comment: Wasn't overly impressed, after a determined search to find the restaurant amidst the construction and renovations taking place. Once inside, the decor is good enough. The beer list is fairly long and they do offer "sampler sets" but they are large 6-8oz pours at S$14 per set. They definitely should make them smaller and perhaps offer a set of five. Just a better business model I've seen work some many other paces. The food was fine. They definitely specialize in beef and the proportions to price were less than appealing. While understanding Singapura is expensive, it seemed a bit overpriced for the ambiance (or lack there of), while watching patrons from a nearby gym club swim in the pool just on the other side of the windows. Definitely a step down from their previous location in/near Katong. While I wasn't aware of them there, it seems like it was a much better location for attracting customers. Oh well.

Get your Kaya on at Wang Cafe. It's open daily between 07:30 - 21:30. There is always people eating something at this place, I have never seen it empty. Many come here in the morning for the home-made kaya, toast bread, soft-boiled eggs and local coffee and tea. The Mee Siam taste authentic with lots of flavor and they also serve mee rebus and laksa throughout the day. Sometimes I pick up an iced lemon tea after work on my way to the MRT, because it is right at the entrance of the pedestrian bridge to labrador park MRT.

A pretty decent Pizza place in Dempsey. Due to Covid i think they are seating customers inside the neighboring  cafe (which looks great in its own right!). We tried the lamb meatball, leek and garlic pizza. The toppings were great, it's good to see places take risks with a bit unconventional toppings.  The only thing lacking was the sourdough crust.. it was a tad undercooked. For a pizza oven, it probably meant spending just 30 seconds to a min longer in the oven. APart from that.. its a decent pizza place.

address: Sentosa Gateway #01-05, Sentosa Boardwalk Singapore 098072 Singapore
comment: Having beer and fries with friends. Ordered an Indian Pale Ale Tower, Chili Cheese Fries, Truffle Fries, Chocolate Ice-cream, and Calamari. :)

address: Sentosa Gateway #01-05, Sentosa Boardwalk Singapore 098072 Singapore
comment: Nice place to drop in for some food, unless you have your car with you, where parking seem to be only available at Vivo or Sentosa.Place was full as we had the last table . Service was good even when it was full. The food came fast as Probably most of the customers were drinking rather than eating .... it's a microbrewery anyway.The theming decorations were good and atmosphere was great. Amazing they have a Kids menu.

address: Sentosa Gateway #01-05, Sentosa Boardwalk Singapore 098072 Singapore
comment: Want a great location for an evening meal? You can't go wrong with Brewerkz located in the middle of Sentosa Boardwalk.We chanced upon it while walking back to mainland after a day in USS. Despite my headache, I agreed to 'seize the moment' and stayed in to have a few beers and snacks. The drinks were the same as you would get in bars anywhere else and not exceptional (about 16 for a beer), though some of them are from their own microbrewery. The snacks were also unexceptional but definitely satisfactory. The onion rings were $9 for a fairly large basket, and desserts of brownie with ice cream and bread pudding with ice cream were $10 each with equally decent portions. The best part is the view, which is really what you're paying for. The sparkling lights on the floor to mimick the night sky above coupled with the serenity of the sea and the distant twinkling of the cable car lights was a simply divine combination. At 9pm, we were unexpectedly treated to some sort of light show in the distance of a floating platform in front of Sentosa. I'm guessing many already know about this but it looks like two birds fighting and ended off with loads of water, light and fireworks. From our location, it was perfect, not too loud or crowded, and with the soft backdrop of the bar music. We had actually just paid and were about to leave for the bus home but were mesmerised by the fireworks and abstract lights.This is a very romantic location to bring a date, or just a laid-back environment to chill with friends.

address: Sentosa Gateway #01-05, Sentosa Boardwalk Singapore 098072 Singapore
comment: The food and beer selection was great here! Hit the spot after a long day touring around Sentosa. The King burger was great and their truffle fries were delicious. The only thing that bugged the shit out of me was the emo 20 something wannabe hipster with a man bun waiter who kept pacing back and fourth in front of my table. WTF dude? Let me eat my sammich in peace.

address: 16 Science Dr 2 National University of Singapore Singapore 117546 Singapore
comment: Hearty and well-balanced meals that leave you filled and guilt-free.They offer three sizes for the food boxes, for which you can choose ingredients to go into. Even the small ($6.50) is sizable and filling, and the only difference for the medium ($7.50) is that you get one more Premium ingredient.I got the Duck & Salmon as the Premium ingredients in my Medium salad, which I felt was more than enough. The Duck was very tender and well-seasoned for my saladI would most definitely come back here again, especially since the seating and ambiance are so modern!

address: 16 Science Dr 2 National University of Singapore Singapore 117546 Singapore
comment: Thirsty Guys double chocolate drink ($2.90) - 2.5 starsThey were out of pearls, which are an additional $0.60 anyway. I was disappointed that the additional chocolate sauce came from a Hershey's bottle since this drink isn't cheap! I just paid $3 for chocolate milk. It was too sweet so the server kindly helped me top it up with water. They also only have full cream milk. I'd probably go for Sharetea at Kent Ridge if I need the walk.

address: 16 Science Dr 2 National University of Singapore Singapore 117546 Singapore
comment: This is probably one of my favorite on campus dining options. As an international student I'm so glad I found this place because it has more western dining options and sometimes I just want to eat a salad.

On the expensive side, but really tasty. They use real charcoal so you get a much better flavor than with a gas grill. And they cook the meat for you! For six people, we ordered:1. Thin-sliced brisket (WooSamYeop) 28 SGD x 2. Would definitely order this again, and again and again. The brisket was subtly marinated and cooked to crisp perfection. 2. Yangnyum Galbi 45 SGD x 2. Would also order this again. It was a fantastic flavor. 3. Marinated pork belly (Mansinchang) 25 SGD. Also delicious4. Premium beef (Ggot Sal) 38 SGD. Again, very tasty. I found this and the Galbi to be pretty interchangeable?5. Jap Chae 23 SGD. Christian loved this dish. I think he finished it single-handedly. 6. Dolsot Bibimbap 15. Very reasonable price for dolsot bibimbap, but an uninspired interpretation. 7. Seafood Pancake (Haemul Pajeon) 22 SGD. Much eggier than the versions that I'm used to. I didn't really like this and wouldn't order it again. 8. Sundubu Jigae 18 SGD. We barely touched this and I definitely wouldn't order it again.There's not a wide variety of banchan, but you get a lot of veggies. Next time, I would weigh much more heavily towards meat.

4 stars only because the army stew here has beef broth in it. I love beef but for most of my friends who can't eat beef for religious purpose, it's a bummer. It's been a while since I've been here but since I was in the vicinity and craving army stew for a long while, we decided to head over there.Verdict:- Army stew (contains beef broth and pork) - This is delicious except that I found the soup abit lacking in taste, to which I added some soyabean chili paste. Yum! The stag will thoughtfully put a pot of soup on your table in case you need to top up the soup, which gets thicker and spicier as it boils.  - Woo Samgyup - This is their trademark beef with marinated sauce. Guess the trademark comes from the secret sauce recipe. The beef is tender and juicy yet thin. It's like shabu beef on grill! - Pork belly grill - This is awesome as always; well marinated. But I found the fats pretty daunting so I stuck mostly to the beef! Total bill came up to $100 exact! How often is it you get a whole, round number? :) All in all, I was amazed that the staff grilled the meat for you which could be a Singapore thing. However, if you go to other korean restaurants at Tanjong Pagar, some of them let you grill the meat yourself. That's the fun part I feel!Tip: Go there early for dinner as the dinner crowd starts streaming in from 630pm. I was there at 530pm and got a nice seat quickly.

I stopped here on Tuesday for lunch with my family. It was pretty quiet inside (at about noon I believe) so we were seated immediately. We ordered the Woo Samgyup, marinated beef and bibimbop. My favorite dish was the Woo Samgyup. The meat was amazing and when I wrapped it in lettuce with a bit of shaved green onions and sauce it was even better. This was my first time having Woo Samgyup, and I have to say that I will definitely have it again. The only thing is that aside from cooking for you at your table, the servers don't really stop by to check up on you.

Sunday lunch with mommy and I was craving for a korean food so here we are. Trying bornga for the first time. The food is very delicious and a bit pricey when I first saw it, but it turned out it was worth it. They served a long tray of veggies, limited variation of banchan (side dishes) and very very refreshing seaweed soup. YUM! The galbi and the pork belly were very satisfying. The waitress cooked the meat, so we dont have a chance to slow down our eating speed, and i wasnt allowed to put garlic on top of the grill. Sad! I love eating meat with grilled garlic. We also ordered their kimchi soup but it was just so so. I would come here again when I crave for some korean food.

I went into this restaurant not knowing what to expect and merely base it on the reviews I read on Yelp. When I saw the long queue outside and the abundance of tables inside when I enter, I was surprised and thought it must be an awesome marketing strategy! To make you feel like it's very popular!But I can't blame them, during our meals, the servers have been very dedicated to help us grill our meats that they are probably quite shorthanded.Service-wise, their servers literally stood beside my table and cooked the meat well for us, leaving us to fully enjoy our meal. Tea however was often not refilled, and I don't like that they use plastic containers for the tea. As for the food, the kimchi soup is nice and authentic, but a little too spicy for me. For each time we visit, always loved them serving the long row of vegetables that are so fresh, crunchy and so... green!Each time, I ordered only two sets of meat for two persons to share and couldn't finish it. Tried their five spices marinated meat, pork belly, the first page highly recommended beef and the premium beef set. Ranges from $22-$48.Overall, this is a nice Korean restaurant that I would love to visit again, though its a little pricey.

Recently, I was in Bornga Vivo City Singapore, I was not impressed. The vegetables were not fresh and makes wrapping the meat in it, seems less delicious. The Kimchi Jigae has deteriorated as well. The rice is dry. The service staff look like they don't want to work there. Consider retraining and incentivizing your service staff better. Don't take short cuts, don't lower quality.

Absolutely delicious meats that are priced decently. I am definitely sold!I am in love with their green platter. Their vegetables are fresh and yummy and I am surprised to see that most of the other patrons hardly touched it. The less than perfect thing about Bornga is that their banchan side dishes are limited. We were only served 3 standard types of side dishes (everyone had the same 3) and although they tasted good, I was slightly disappointed at the lack of selection. But having said that, the delicious meats and reasonable prices will bring me back! I am getting hungry just thinking about it.....

If you go in with the understanding that this is 2.5 times the price of a similar restaurant in Korea, and that you will need to repeatedly ask for refills on things that would be automatically refilled in Korea, you will probably be satisfied with this restaurant.They did raise their prices to the point that a woo samgyup dinner for two with no drinks is $73 out the door. The food is arguably good enough to justify it though.

One of the best Korean BBQ I have tried. Heard the owner is a celebrity chef from Korea. Pricy but quality food. The pork belly were very well marinated and of good quality. The beef were fresh and quality too. It is good that someone helped us grill the meat. Most of the time we overcooked the meat when we DIY. Those side dishes were simply delicious and quality. They serve a long tray of veggies which is very fresh. Table setting were alright, not too cramp. Quite a nice ambience for dine & chat with family or business associates. Would recommend for those who don't mind paying a little more for quality food.
Very nice food...it's the recipe from famous Korean chef...the marinated beef ribs is super yummy along with the lettuce and sauce.. Definitely will go back again
This was by far ons of the greatest food experiences i have ever had in niet entree life. The service was great and so was the food. They all also had great attitudes.

address: Mapletree Business City 20 Pasir Panjang Road, #02-17 Singapore Singapore
comment: Please stay awayhorrible service and very rude staffthere were good people here but all left - and the replacements are rude and amateurish

address: 321 Alexandra Rd #01-07, Alexandra Central Mall Singapore 159971 Singapore
comment: I visited tonight based on the reviews and was surprised that I was the only patron the food was good and the service was as you'd expect good considering but when a solo meal costs $37 it's a little rich. I live in the states and this meal would have been closer to $23 at most. I object to paying close to $14 for curry only to pay an extra $4 for rice! This should be free for basic rice that's I why I give 3 stars

Terrible fish preparation and some not too fresh items.I was here for dinner, and there weren't too many people on a weekday night. It was fun using the iPad to place your order, but it was the usual menu of bento sets and sushi rolls. Nothing caught my eye. The sushi wasn't rolled too well, and it was unraveling as it sat on my plate. The rice wasn't seasoned evenly, and the fish wasn't too fresh either, and it ended up a soggy chewy mess that I wasn't able to finish.Unfortunately, Yelp let me down today. I'm not sure how this place got rave reviews, but I notice that the gap between the last review in 2014 and my visit in 2015 is about a year or more. I suspect that their best sushi chef left for greener pastures.Might be ok for a weekday lunch, but my stomach votes to go elsewhere the next time.

Walk around the Vivo city to look for this restaurant, finally find out it in the basement. Food quality is good as a Japanese restaurant. Service is good too. The only downside is that don't judge the size by the photos in menu.

I still think the quality here is better than sushi tei, but the maki I had here last night had so little fish in it that they might as well have not put any. The fish portion of both my tuna and salmon maki could have been completely covered by a 5 cent coin with room to spare. It was a joke.

Came for a weekday lunch, no queue, so wasn't expecting much. Didn't try much. However, the quality was pretty decent and more than reasonably priced. Fish was very fresh. I am definitely coming back to try more :) My first impression was definitely good.

Akashi is the place I go to when i want to eat good Japanese food at reasonable prices. Located at the basement of Vivocity Mall, this branch of the ever popular Akashi chain of restaurants possibly has the best location out of all the Akashi restaurants. It is easily accessible because of the Harbour Front MRT station, and being located in a mall by the sea allows one to take slow leisurely walks to fend off the post dinner coma. The sashimi here is cut lusciously thick; the katsu is addictively crispy on the outside, and sits on a bed of fluffy white rice. Prices are pretty reasonable too, as with all Akashi restaurants. I recommend calling ahead though, because this branch can get quite crowded at dinner time.

Came here to fuel us up after mass and we had:Seafood Tomyam Pasta - fettuccine tossed in creamy sauce that is infused with Tomyam spice. The seafood (mussels and grilled prawns) was fresh and generous in amount. Overall a tasty dish. The Fuel Plus Burger - hubby liked his burger. He also enjoyed the Sweet potato fries that accompanied the burger! Honey Baby Back Ribs - my FIL enjoyed his the most he declared. I tried a bite and the meat was moist yet falls-off-bone tender. Seasoning also on point. Mad about Salmon - MIL said it's nice. Salmon meat was not dry and Rosti was great too. Beef Mac & Cheese - daughter didn't like the shell pasta but she still polished the whole tray of baked pasta! Haha... the sauce base is tomato with cheese over it. Think it's more lasagna than Mac & Cheese really. BBQ Cheeseburger - this should be good because my 8 year old ate the WHOLE burger unassisted! This only happens when she is super hungry or food is good. I'll lean towards the burger being good. Parking here is road side and a nightmare so if you don't like to illegally park, you may need to do a stake-out. Having said that, I'll find another time to try their desserts.

Had a good lunch with a fellow Yelper Nik and then we were deciding where to go for desserts. Nik recommended Fuel Plus+ and so we went. The parking spaces along the roads were limited and the place doesn't look like any nice cafe would exist but I was very. very wrong. We saw a nice cafe that had nice setting and two very wonderful, polite and smiley servers! They made us felt at home with their wonderful sweet smile and I momentarily forgot about the place being a bit "ulu" or secluded. As we have had lunch, we browsed through the menu for desserts and saw a few dessert selections. Initially we were a but disappointed on the small selection for desserts but that would all change, just the way they change my opinion about the cafe with their wonderful sweet smiles! I had the Salted Caramel Pancakes and my Friend Nik had the Apple Crumble. Had a taste of the Apple Crumble and it was good! The Salted Caramel Pancakes were fantastic too!! It had strawberries, blueberries and bananas and they blended perfectly with the Pancakes so well that it makes the Salted Pancakes tasted even better! As I am writing, I am still having the taste of the Salted Caramel Pancakes in my mouth and that's just how much I liked the desserts!!I am definitely gonna come back to try their selections of lunch and definitely other desserts as well! Do come pay this place a visit and let your hair down and rest your legs and sip your coffee. In a nice secluded place that amazes!
Nice hidden gem on wishart rd. Desserts good. Coffee good. Venue good. Location ? Erm

Prima Tower revolving restaurant is the only revolving restaurant in Singapore. Being established in 1977, they are located at Keppel Road, sitting on top of a grain silo, serving Beijing Cuisine as well as dim sum for lunch. Having visited 4-5 times here on Business Agenda, this place and her food had never failed to entice me.Locating the restaurant may be a little tricky as a miss in a turn will make you go a big round to locate it. Since its located within Prima's premises, parking lots are rather limited. However, valet services are provided for diner, thus one do not have to get stress out of parking lots.Once entering the lobby area, diners have to take the lift up followed by a flight of winding stairs to reach the 11th floor then escalator. Interior is in line with the old school traditional vibe with rosewood furnishing, fish tank, round tables with lazy Suzy and square tables. Atmosphere is like tuning into a time machine, going back in time into 1980s.The entire one round of revolution takes about an hour and of course the best seats are by the side of the windows offering a panoramic view to the surroundings to the PSA and Sentosa Island.On our visit, we had the Menu 5 for 6 persons instead of ala carte.Shredded Scallops with Fish & Egg White is one of Prima Tower's Signatures. The dish was served with ingredients segregated, thereafter the server will perform the mixture of egg, egg white, fish and scallops in front of us.Shredded Scallops with Fish & Egg White 赛螃蟹Despite of the dish name in Mandarin that mentioned crab, there was no sign of crab as an ingredient. The combination of ingredients blend well into one another which is sweet and delighting to our palates, very suitable to start off our meals like this. To enjoy this starting dish, add some black vinegar and pepper for taste.2nd dish on the menu was Fish Maw and Seafood in Thick Soup. Similar to the 1st Dish, we added vinegar and pepper for taste. The serving is prepared in personal potand the thick soup too, was fresh and refreshing.Fish Maw & Seafood in Thick Soup 鱼鳔海鲜羹The legendary Chinese Dish - the Peking Duck. Glistering Peking Duck will be parked by a side on a trolley waiting to be carved by the skillful waitress / waiter. If you are wondering where does the rest of the meat gone to after having its skin encased in the egg wrap. Well, the meat can be used as ingredients for other dishes such as fried rice.Authentic Barbecued Peking Duck 烤北京填鸭We have ordered egg wraps and staff will fill the wrap with the crispy duck skin, spring onion and bean sauce.Soon Hock Fish was served in Teochew style with light and tasty broth. The meat was tender and topped with garnishing like coriander and chilli stripes.Steamed Soon Hock in Teochew Style 潮式蒸顺壳Another dish that struck me by surprise will be their stewed pork ribs that was served separately with buns. In Dialect, Hokkien language, we called this "Kong Bak" where by this braised meat was sandwich in between the pieces of fluffy buns. In this case, its more of pull pork. The meat was fork tender and easily fell off with little force asserted.Stewed Pork Ribs (Served with Buns) 京烤骨皇 （代花卷）These pork meat was very flavorful in its generous serving of braised sauce with a few stalks of coriander to enhance its taste. Having said that, the pork was not greasy at all.The buns that come in a set with the Stewed Pork are fluffy and looked different from the usual "flat pouches" kind of bun we had from else where. Instead, these came in shapes and had some lines patterns on the surface.Soup was sweet and delighting with Chinese spinach, shredded scallops, wolf berries in superior broth.Chinese Spinach with Shredded Scallops, Wolfberry & Whole Garlic in Superior Broth上汤蒜子干贝杞子灼苋菜An ending surprise with souffle balls encased with red bean stuffing. Even though it was fried, exterior was not greasy and amazingly soft. Initially we thought desserts was fish balls but the skin was soft, taste of egg white and chewy.Souffle Balls with Red Bean Stuffing 高丽豆沙I love its texture, also given that the red bean stuffing was not too sweet.And just this month, we visited in smaller group and ordered Menu 4.Menu 4A popular delicacy in a Chinese restaurant whereby sharkfin was flavored in stock. Soup was great with ingredients like Fish Maw, crab meat, fish and chicken.Braised Shark Fin Soup with Seafood 海鲜鱼翅Enhance the taste of the delicacy by adding black vinegar and pepper.

One of my faves growing up. It was a special treat whenever we get to have dinner here. Must haves are Peking duck, egg white with scallops, egg soufflé with red bean. Of course there's always good seafood too. Hard to beat view of Sentosa and night scene as the restaurant revolves around. I remember it was always fun to find the restroom as it's never in the same place!

It's been quite a while since I went to this restaurant. The food quality seemed to have dropped. And funnily, there is only one person who can take order now. Process have gone up two. For diners cost us $200 for normal har gau, siew mai and Cheong fun. Scenery is still nice, rotating restaurant still had their attraction for kids.

It must have been decades since I've been back (ok maybe one and a half) and yet it feels like nothing has changed at Prima Tower Revolving Restaurant. And in a good way too. There's a nostalgic charm about this place as it rotates you through the ever-evolving skyline of Singapore. There's a current Peking duck and seafood special that is a really great deal at just $288 nett for 10 persons. Really enjoyed the shredded scallop and fish in egg egg whites. It was just so delicate and light but you got the full flavor of the seafood. Same applies to the broccoli & crab dish. The fish maw & seafood soup, the Peking duck, and the  sea bass were pretty good too. I found the stewed pork to be on the fatty side and didn't really care for the jelly desert. Still all in all, it was a very delicious meal and since we added some dim sum to the menu, we were stuffed and satisfied. Service is efficient albeit a little curt. Still, you get lovely views of the city as you go through your meal and that compensates for a lot. Even if you're not getting a multi-course banquet, it's still worth to come up here for dim sum and the views.
Excellent dim sum. The floor revolves around just like the Space Needle in Seattle. Nice views of the harbor and city.

Before there were PrimaDeli bakeries and vacuum-sealed packs of sauce, Prima the flour mill decided they would open a restaurant. At 37 years old, Prima might be the oldest revolving restaurant in Singapore. It is also, according to them, the only revolving restaurant situated on top of grain silos in the world. It's a good thing I only read that after lunch because under the right conditions, flour can act like explosives. Erm. Right. On to the important stuff--does it revolve? Yes! So you get a nice view of Sentosa-Keppel-Mount Faber-Telok Blangah and back again. It moves slowly, say 30min for one full rotation, so unless you're very sensitive no one will lose their lunch. Today being a public holiday they were full house for lunch; I heard that this place usually serves the lunch crowd, but best to call ahead in any case. We had the set menu (which was on promotion) so it worked out to under $30/pax, including the nommy Peking duck. Many other families also thought it was good value and ordered that; however, Prima also has an extensive dim sum menu that other tables were ordering from. I am going to return to try that out! Food was tasty (Beijing cuisine, the menu said; old-time flavours, the aunties said. ), service was prompt (never had to prompt for tea, food came out at a comfortable pace, only had to wait for dessert but that was when they were at their fullest). So. Yes. Come for the novelty, and enjoy a good meal with it!

Love their service and especially their sticky date pudding. One of the most value for money sticky date pudding I've had and the portion and taste is awesome! The way the sticky date pudding is served is also rather different from any others out there. You have the ice cream sandwiched between 2 slices of cake and the sauce around. A good way to have a spoonful of all the goodies in one mouth. They also serve half portions for pasta and sandwiches. Check with the server to get more info on that. Do note that it's really crowded during meal times so go during off peak to enjoy your meal in peace.

Affordable fare (at least in the area) and decent enough. We had the beef sandwich, garlic prawn pizza, smoked salmon salad, ravioli and lasagna for dinner.The beef sandwich was pretty decent and the other items were acceptable. Nothing fantastic but not badly executed either. I wouldn't mind coming here again if I were stuck in Tanglin Mall, given the dearth of options.

had a coffee pow wow here with none other than our CM!:)nice environment.no wait for table.menus promptly given and left me alone to decide.not sure what the deal is with tanglin mall but the last time i was here there was a fire alarm test.today again, they had a fire alarm test!!!???can be annoying when you are trying to chillax.i pity the poor mommy trying to nurse her baby next to me!not sure whether marcus was lunching here, so i ordered a latte whilst i waited for him to arrive.texted him and ordered a latte for him too!my latte art was missing.his arrived with a nice heart shape and he timed his entrance to perfection!so much so that, i didn't even had a chance to point and shoot at his!:(to me their latte is good.organic coffee by aroma.hopefully, no fire alarm test the next time i come?

Very convenient cafe restaurant.  They serve sandwiches, pasta, pizza, etc.  Pizza is near Roma type, but tastes good.  Very reasonable and makes you stop by when you want a tea and snack.  Try the lasagna, it's great!カフェの延長ですね。食べ物はピザが一番無難かな。アイスチャイを頼んだら失敗したので要注意。チキンアボガドサラダはボチボチ、あ、ラザニアは小さくてパスタも薄いけど挽肉の味付けがかなり美味かった！2015/11

My family's favorite breakfast place. We love the coffee, break, eggs, shaved gam and avocado plate. My kids love the chocolate shake and my husband loves the tuna sandwich. We just can't get enough of the food at thus cafe:)

Café Beviamo is a nice café to grab a bite in Tanglin Mall. The busiest times there would be during lunch and sometimes you may have to wait for a table. Its frequented by a lot of expat housewives that live around the area. The food is really good here though. My favorite thing to get would be the all day breakfast. Perfect scrambled eggs served with buttered toast and tomatoes. They also have a sweet vanilla risotto served with stewed apples which makes for an interesting alternative to oatmeal. They have numerous sandwhiches which are all freshly made on their rustic ciabatta or soft brown bread. Desserts here are pretty good too, try the sticky date pudding with vanilla ice cream. And a must have is the soy chai tea latte--the best in Singapore.

On the main level of Tanglin Mall, Caffe Beviamo is always jam packed with mainly expats from morning tea onwards into late afternoon. Very simple straight forward café food here, nothing really inspiring or funky on the menu, just comforting café classics like bruschetta, sandwiches, bolognaise pasta etc. They also have a wide selection of cakes, cookies and other nibbley bits. Has an Australian influence throughout the menu, lamingtons, rocky road etc. This is great for someone like me that misses home from time to time, though a lamington that isn't filled with jam and cream!!! That just cannot be!, as an aussie in my book it should be a criminal offence to do a lamington which isn't wedged with both jam and cream, saying that though it is a pretty decent piece of cake. Service while not the most knowledgeable is always cheerful and helpful. Good place for a cheap comforting lunch.

Like the place. It's quite chic. Coffee is great and the service is decent. Margarita pizza is nice and wife tried the prawn pizza and she said it was alright but preferred the pepperoni. She most likes the sausage and peas pasta

good food. but do not expect good service. love the ciabatta/turkish toast. they let you customize the order as much as possible...i.e. half portions (at half the price), good for eating out with kids.

address: 30 Napier Rd The Britsh Council Singapore 258509 Singapore
comment: Really enjoy this little restaurant connected to the British Council.  The owner Peter is a great guy and very welcoming.  The food is always tasty and flavorful and varies from day to day.  Small seating area inside and a covered outdoor area as well.

address: Sentosa Gateway  Resorts World Sentosa Southern 098269 Singapore
comment: I thought one Michelin star means they would put decent people to serve you as well.The foods was very well presented it but the staffs just made your experience unbelievably disappointed.We felt that they are trying to rush us out of the restaurant.  We got 4 different people serving us with none of them connect to each other as to what our needs were. Two kept coming by asking if they can take our unfinished plate.  If the plate is still half full, it MEANS we are still eating!!!  If we didn't finished our glass of wine pairing wait!!!! Who the hell bring a new glass out while we are still enjoying the previous glass.I know they are trying to carter to us their 5 stars service because the whole restaurant only got 3 tables but people need a little space enjoying their meal OMG!!! We don't need answer to 3-4 people what we are still enjoying our wine, our foods, Never coming back.  There are more better restaurant out there to try if the price we spent like Andre.  Btw/ the manager got really bad breath and he pour the wine like shit.  Fix that before your restaurant goes down the hole!

address: Sentosa Gateway  Resorts World Sentosa Southern 098269 Singapore
comment: OSIA is a newly awarded One Michelin Star in the Resorts World Sentosa. It is pretty easy to get a reservation on Chope, or even as a simple walk-in on a busy Friday night in Sentosa.My first impression was thinking...this is definitely one of the least attractive spaces to label as a Michelin Star (that is, one that isn't a hawker). It looked like a normal cafe with an identity conflict being casual vs dressy. However, my mind changed pretty quickly when I encountered the impeccable service from the very beginning. The hostesses are amongst the kindest and most professional I've ever come across in ANY restaurant. I was quickly seated and provided the giant one page menu and their drink menu which was mostly French and Australian wines, with a lacking cocktail menu. The wine sommelier (quite a young sommelier for a Michelin Star restaurant) assisted me in selecting a bottle of Australian Shiraz which was actually also their house Shiraz and quite good. I ordered the following:1) Truffled Kalamata Olive Flatbread - They served this with a Pistachio butter that came in what looked like a toothpaste tube which was slightly unattractive. The flatbread was a nice starter.2) I unfortunately don't remember which steak I ordered but it was the recommended Australian steak. It definitely was not presented well but had a great flavor that I truly enjoyed. They give you two small beakers with a sesame sauce and some other sauce that you can play with along with three side garnishes to enjoy. The meat was extremely soft and flavorful.3) Hot Chocolate Soup for dessert - This was their recommended dessert but I can't understand why. You are literally served a cup of hot chocolate sauce (similar to the lava from a Chocolate Lava Cake) and a cup of vanilla ice cream. That's it. It's as if I was drinking a rich hot chocolate with a side of vanilla ice cream. Very unoriginal and I felt ripped off by this.Frankly, although this restaurant had good flavors and solid service, I scratch my head thinking how this was awarded a Michelin Star. CUT at Marina Bay Sands is lightyears ahead of OSIA (my opinion) with regards to flavor, drinks, wine, ambiance, everything and that is what you would actually be comparing in the same category. Michelin aside, it's good although not entirely memorable.However, if you are on a Michelin Star hunt, extremely hungry for steak and stuck in Sentosa, then I would definitely recommend OSIA.

address: Sentosa Gateway  Resorts World Sentosa Southern 098269 Singapore
comment: The boyfriend brought me here for our staycation at Sentosa. Let me just start off by saying that their Sour Cream & Onion flatbread is to die for! It also comes with a side of this chickpea-like paste (I forgot what it was called), which paired well with it. It's a good starter for those with smaller appetites, because it leaves space for the heavier stuff.We also shared a seafood platter; grilled octopus, King prawns, scallops, a half lobster, and a small bowl of clams in white wine. They paired it with a side of hollandaise sauce & cocktail shrimp sauce, which were both really good!For desert we had the macadamia soufflé - the portion was huge, and it was really tasty! No regrets loading the extra calories! Definitely would come back!

address: Sentosa Gateway  Resorts World Sentosa Southern 098269 Singapore
comment: Osia's modern Australian, seafood-centric menu was excellent. Fresh, clean flavours abound, and cooking styles were deliberately kept delicate. Perhaps it's the lack of a dining crowd during lunchtimes, but Osia's set lunch menu, at only $45 for a 3-course set ($35 for 2-courses), is probably one of the most value-for-money ever. A competitively priced set lunch in order to draw in the customers, I supposeService was excellent at Osia. I'd gotten terribly lost in the labyrinth of a carpark and was an angry mess by the time I arrived at the restaurant, but the waiter was so empathetic, so cheery, downright nice, that it wasn't long before I cooled down. And despite a couple of serious cock-ups (the restaurant's power tripped which caused the credit card facilities to fail, so after 20 minutes of trying to swipe our cards, we were then told that only cash was accepted, and there was this faint stench of the sewage that reeked through the restaurant towards the end of the lunch dining hour), service recovery was fantastic. Apologies were profuse and sincere, and reparation efforts were made to provide us a better dining experience by way of a discounted return visit. We had:1) Mixed Flatbread ($11), a chewy confection burnished half with Truffled Kalamata Olives and the other half with Macadamia Pesto.2) A starting option on the set lunch menu, the Black Angus Beef Tenderloin Carpaccio, dusted with dukkah spice and topped with creamy egg mayonnaise: scrumptious.3) Cardamom Citrus-Cured Yellowtail Amberjack: another starter, crisp and refreshing, complemented by the mild sweetness of fennel and the fruity bite of a thick orange-ginger foam.4) Pan-Fried Foie Gras (supplement $12): a stellar mainstay in their rotating stable of appetizers. The melty richness of the liver was balanced with a whipped light-as-air banana mash, Jamaican rum and Madagascar vanilla.5) Onto the mains, the Chicken Leg Confit: set atop a velvety garlic potato mash, slathered in a luscious red wine sauce, and contrasted with the subtle bitterness of charred radicchio.6) Braised Compressed Oxtail: fork-tender, and laden with ratatouille and blanketed in a caramelized onion puree and robust red wine sauce.7) For a lighter entree, the flaky Grilled Perch, stewed with boiled potato and fennel in a tomato fish broth, was flavourful and exquisite. This was served in an earthernware and then ladled onto a bowl for consumption.8) For dessert, there was just the one option of a sublime Valrhona Hot Chocolate Soup with black pepper-spiked vanilla ice-cream and sesame crisp. Great textures and wonderfully balanced

address: Sentosa Gateway  Resorts World Sentosa Southern 098269 Singapore
comment: Things are heating up at Resorts World Sentosa! First there's the reintroduction of the weekend lunches at Joel Robuchon restaurants. Then this weekend, Celebrity Chef Andrew Turner of Hotel Café Royal in London is presenting his specially created dishes (13 to 16 May) alongside resident Chef Scott Webster.We started our set dinner with some Stone Hearth Flat Bread served with extra virgin olive oil, butter and dip. Truffled Kalamata Olive and Macadamia Pesto are the hot favorites here and i enjoyed the fluffy hot bread when it was first served. Osia's Char Grilled Fremantle Octopus with cucumber apple slaw and green chili jam failed to impress with its rubbery texture.  Osia won me back with their Pan fried Foie Gras by with textures of banana (in espuma and caramelized form), Madagascar vanilla and Jamaican rum. It's a first having bananas paired with foie gras and it was surprisingly a good match due to the savory and salty caramelized bananas. The signature Osia dish is the Perch with sesame ratte potato, pea tendril, soy milk curd and a shiromiso glaze. Light tasting dish with a little sweetness from the miso.

address: Sentosa Gateway  Resorts World Sentosa Southern 098269 Singapore
comment: We came here for a small celebration. Both ordered the set menu, one with 4 courses, the other with 5 courses. We also had the flatbread. The food is good, well-presented, with quality ingredients. The expectations are met for a good restaurant, but does not have the makings of an excellent one, we did not walk away wow-ed by the food. Our experience was marred by the inability of the wait staff to execute their duties with pride. They were malaise, and at time downright condescending and rude in their communication with us. Unfortunately, this was the case for 3 of the 4 wait staff we encountered. Despite an empty restaurant (only 3 other tables were occupied) and four wait staff loitering the area, the front of house was at a total loss. No one filled our water. We mentioned that we wanted wine with our mains, but no one followed up or offered the wine menu. When we were seated, one wait staff said "We can offer you our flatbread, please choose two toppings". We were later charged for the flatbread, and duly paid. However, this left a poor impression as we did not feel that the wait staff was unaware of the implications of the words she chose.We spent approx $350 for the dinner. For this price, there are numerous other places one have visited for a memorable dinner with better food quality and service. We will not return, and recommend that if you choose to patronise this establishment, try it for a casual night instead of a special occasion.

address: Sentosa Gateway  Resorts World Sentosa Southern 098269 Singapore
comment: If you are still searching for the perfect brunch in Singapore, and a place that allows you to idle time away, your search would probably come to an end after experiencing Osia. Osia Long Sunday Lunch was indeed a treat for the senses!Must tries include the flat Bread, Freshly shucked seasonal premium oysters, foie gras.For for full review and photos: travellah.wordpress.com/….

address: Sentosa Gateway  Resorts World Sentosa Southern 098269 Singapore
comment: Osia has the best flat bread in town, along with a unique sauce-in-a-tube concept!  It makes dining here exciting and interesting, and the serving sizes are good.  However, the gnocchi is just average, and it is hard to get a waiter to notice you when trying to get service.  Nevertheless, if you come here often enough, the waiters do remember your name and wish you well at the end of the meal, which is nice.

address: Sentosa Gateway  Resorts World Sentosa Southern 098269 Singapore
comment: okay i might be biased on this one since it use to fall under my watch but it is still one of the best aussie restaurants in singapore with Chef Douglas Tay at the helm of the kitchen which has a great stone hearth oven.  The flat breads, seafood experience and anything from that oven is great.  It is located on the resorts world property so it is away from town and hidden but a great place for a night of wine & dine.  I have never been crazy about the interiors but it works.  The open kitchen is great and Amanda the manager always has the best smile and service.  Try their special beer as well too.  This is one of Aussie celeb chef Scott Webster's restaurants that we ran.  Scotty always give value for money and uses top ingredients.  A great place for visitors to singapore and locals to try.

address: Sentosa Gateway  Resorts World Sentosa Southern 098269 Singapore
comment: A good friend J who works in the publishing industry is constantly inundated by requests for tastings in new restaurants, and so gets to nosh on very finely prepared food for free, often before the rest of us mere mortals. As a result, he has become somewhat spoiled in the gastronomical department, with very jaded taste buds. So when he rang me up one day and gushed about a new restaurant, I sat up and took notice. In fact, he even went so far as to proclaim it the to-go place to take someone he'd want to impress.When faced with such a bold statement., I quickly grabbed the nearest friend and went down to Osia as soon as our schedules allowed.Food : The truffled  kalamanta olive flatbreads were pretty yummy and came with a tube of squeezable dip which was really fun! I loved loved loved the seafood ice experience. Maybe I'm partial to seafood, and maybe also because I'm partial to sorbet, but this was such a great combination. I always believed that if one served the best produce, one needs to do very little to actually enhance its flavour. And nowhere was this clearer than in this particular dish, where the natural sea freshness of the food was sharpened and crystallised by the different accompanying flavours of sorbet. The foie gras was pretty well done, as was the compression of truffled water melon with goat cheese. The beef was decent but the barramundi was so-so. Didn't think much of the chocolate Valrhona soup but then I'm not much of a chocolate fan.Ambience : Lovely, we were there on a Wednesday and it struck a nice balance between bustling and a ghost town.Service : Excellent.Overall a great experience. Only complaint is that it's way out in RWS but would definitely return.

address: 1 Lower Kent Ridge Rd #01-04 Singapore 119082 Singapore
comment: The outlet was located just next to the MRT station. There was a small dine in area but during lunch time it would be difficult to find a seat. The outlet was well known for its Empress Porridge. It also served other dishes with its menu updated weekly online in Facebook and website.Dowager Set (S$10)which included Consort Bee Hoon (S$4), Empress Porridge (S$5/ regular), and a choice of drink which I selected almond.The porridge was a mixture of brown rice and white rice, cooked with dried scallops, cuttlefish, dried shrimp , braised peanut, and tender pork collar. Plain looking, but there's lot of liao inside the porridge. Flavour was just nice. No need for more seasoning.The fried bee hoon was topped with braised vegetable, crispy bean curd skin, sliced red chilli, chilli paste and slices of luncheon meat."Kueh Teng" (S$7)a dish of crispy pan-fried glutinous rice cake (Png Kueh) and hearty stock, fish maw, seasoned minced pork, fresh cabbage and green spinach, for a uniquely satisfying meal.It was packed with a lot of ingredients such as soft napa cabbage, soft spongy fish maw, and juicy crunchy meatballs which packed with crunchy water chestnut, sweet minced shrimp, and earthy chopped mushroom.The pan fried png kueh was soft and nutty, soaking up the flavour from the savoury soup.Spring Roll (S$1.50)It was packed with mung bean vermicelli (Tang Hoon 冬粉) , finely shredded carrot and finely minced dried shrimp. One was not enough.Sweet Potato in Osthmantus Soup (S$1.50)There's dried longan, yellow sweet potato, orange sweet potato, purple sweet potato. So much liaoKueh Salat (S$1.50)Soft and not too sweetBeef Yakiniku Rice Bowl (S$7)Served with caramelized onion, pickled daikon, shredded seaweed and chilli sauceThe meat was very tender and the onion was melt in the mouth.Pork Trotter Bee Hoon (S$5.50)Available on every Friday. The fried bee hoon was topped with braised vegetable, crispy bean curd skin, sliced red chilli, chilli paste and slices of well braised tender pork trotter.Orh Nee (S$2.50)Taro pasteAlthough it looked like there's lots of milk, the paste was very rich and dense with chunks of yam in it. Plus it was not too sweet.Japanese Cheesecake (S$2/ 2pieces)The cake was soft and fluffy.

address: 1 Lower Kent Ridge Rd #01-04 Singapore 119082 Singapore
comment: Tried their Cabbage rice and Hainanese chicken rice. It's just a balance between healthy and hehe(naughty fat food). I'm not a fan for brown rice but the gravy and these nicely done pork makes it so yummy that you will come again the next time. Strongly recommended for ppl who doesn't like brown rice. This is different.As they say"Healthy food is not tasty, Tasty food is not healthy"

address: 1 Lower Kent Ridge Rd #01-04 Singapore 119082 Singapore
comment: The porridge comes in 2 sizes. The big size costs $4.50 and is very filling. We were impressed with the generous serving of ingredients. Every spoonful of porridge has something in it. The speciality empress porridge is a bowl of goodness with ingredients such as pork slice, peanut, dried shrimp and dried scallop etc. There is a homely feel to the place and food. Makes for a really satisfying meal, especially on a rainy day.

The place was located at the end of the road, with a small alfresco dining area. Although it was non aircon, the place was cooling and relaxing. For a weekday, the place enjoyed a healthy flow of crowd.For weekday, the restaurant was having a S$12++ lunch set which consisted of a choice of pasta/ pizza/ salad/ soup/ sandwich and a choice of soft drink. Sausage Linguine Aglio e OlioLinguini cooked with chorizo & broccoli, flavoured with chilli padi & garlic Slightly peppery even after the exclusion of chilli padi

address: 2 Telok Blangah Way Safra Mount Faber Singapore 098803 Singapore
comment: decent place for an easy thai lunch on the weekdays - not too expensive neither. so I believe the eponymous owner of this place gave rise to its rather audacious name (you must supposed that's why it was done), but the food is not nearly as startling.it's decent thai food - the flavors are there, and I'm not one to argue authenticity - in a cafe setting, ever-so-slightly less commercial-feeling than the larger chains like thai express.there are branches of this place popping up all over the island, and I suspect the secret behind its expansion is its rather populous-pleasing flavors. it's not too sweet, not too salty, not too spicy and not too expensive, nor too cheap - which rather expands the demographic it attracts.I came here for a better-than-the-hawker-centre but not-too-fussy lunch with friends on a working day, and it did us pretty well. there is a lunch offer available, the details of which escape me at the moment (the pitfalls of posting long after the event) - but I think it's a combination of a main course and a drink for slightly less than a la carte.we had the chicken cutlet with mango salad and rice (part of a lunch set), and two standalone salads: mango, and a seafood vermicelli one, as well as some stuffed chicken wings. all serviceable, and pretty alright - just as you'd expect from an establishment like this.this is the only branch I've been to, and it's pretty cosy. the place is a cosmopolitan concrete-furnished room with colorful wooden tables, service is succinct and slightly slow during a busy lunch time - though inoffensive, and the prices aren't too bad. decent choice for a weekday lunch when you are slightly more bothered about what you eat - but not too much neither.

address: 2 Telok Blangah Way Safra Mount Faber Singapore 098803 Singapore
comment: Had to eat here!  Small place food was good if not average Thai food.  Service was friendly and good.  That name though how many times can you say you at at Porn's?

address: 2 Telok Blangah Way Safra Mount Faber Singapore 098803 Singapore
comment: I've never been a fan of Thai food, but Porn's actually serves quite nice and good Thai food! I wouldn't know if it's really authentic as I've never been to Thailand nor tasted the 'real' Thai food to judge what's good or not.Suggestive as the name might sound, it's opened by one of Singapore's celebrity, Pornsak, (explains the name) who happens to be a Thai. Perhaps because of the star factor that the outlet at Liang Seah Street is packed with people during the weekends.I like the design of Porn's at SAFRA Mount Faber and will go for their set lunch promotions! I've tried the Pad Thai, Toufu and Tom Yum Soup, it really taste good. For the drinks, I always went with Thai milk tea. The only thing I wasn't too happy at Porn's was the service, especially during billing time. I once had to wait nearly 20mins just to get my receipt, signing on papers again and again. I was rather mad to be honest. It's honestly too slow for a simple meal.Other than that, do visit the place for their food and you might perhaps meet the star owner in the shop!

Service is taking way too long. We are still waiting for our food even thought we have seated for 30 minutes. Granted there's about 50 of us :-)Update (2 hours later):The food came out just after I completed the first paragraph! Gado-gado, tauhu telur, fried chicken, acar fish, rendang and white rice. Everything was v good. Well the gado-gado and rendang were the weakest links but even then they were slightly above average. Delicious lunch. Note - didn't pay directly so not sure whether it was good value
A very disappointing meal. The ingredients were not fresh or of high quality. The tangy spice of Indonesian food in Indonesia was completely missing.

Authentic Indonesian food since 1981. My Family favorites include the flavorful rendang, fluffy tahu telor, perfectly fried Ikan Nila, and the desserts are to die for! Freshly squeezed coconut milk with fragrant gula Melaka.

I get nostalgic when I come to this outlet for a meal, it has been around for a longgg time, I remember coming here with my family maybe more than 10 or 15 years ago.The menu is classic Indonesian dishes - tahu telor is a perennial favourite and so is the rendang. My typical disappointment-proof dishes to order and share is the sambal kangkong (enough to share among 4 people), tahu telor and the fried fish (deliciously fresh!)The only letdown is that they don't serve sweet & sour fish anymore, that used to be my favourite dish growing up! Perhaps it wasn't very Indonesian, they realized? I don't know.Final verdict: Good old reliable restaurant for a satisfying Indonesian feast.

Good Indonesian food - favs include tahu telor, gado gado, Kang kong belacan, Ayam goreng. Nasi Kuning is yum too. Think the standard of food at this decades old location is better than Paragon, and the service too ! However, my favourite place for Indonesian food in Singapore remains Pagi Sore. This is a solid #2 though :)

Another great place to find truly authentic Indonesian Cuisine. One of the few Indonesian restaurants in Singapore to serve the famous Tahu Telor which is basically a deepfried tower of eggs and tofu topped with a sweet-spicy dark sauce. The texture is one that is both crispy and soft. Another crowd favorite at Tambuah Mas would be their signature Chendol with fresh green bean jelly and palm sugar, the perfect way to end your Indonesian meal experience!

address: Blk 6, Jalan Bukit Merah #01-39, ABC Brickworks Food Centre Singapore 153028 Singapore
comment: When I arrived at this popular stall on a weekday at 8.15am for the first time today, there was already a queue 6 deep! Deliciously firm noodles with lean char siu. I'm partial to HK style wontons, which is quite different from local wontons, so I would have given this 4.5 stars. However, the friendliness of the proprietress, her husband and sister really lights up the place and deserves an extra star. Hokkien, Cantonese or Mandarin spoken here.

address: 1 Maritime Square #03-19/20 Harbourfront Centre Singapore 099253 Singapore
comment: Located in HarborFront on level 3, this place is good to catch up on some local delights as well as Thai food. Plus point - it's in an air-conditioned mall. The stall ranges from Vegetable Rice, Ban Mian, Roast Meat, Nasi Padang and Thai. I generally come here for the roast meat selection as well as the Ban Mian stall as they carry a Gan Lao Mian which I pretty much like. I will probably take a picture and write a little more about it the next time I am there. Maybe the only little dislike is that the seating is a little tighter and being my size, I naturally felt a bit too squeezy. Hmmmm.... Time to lose weight... But does that mean I need to stop coming here for my foodie??!!
